title: Second Hong Kong school suspended over unauthorised courses
summary: Hong Kong education authorities have suspended a second private school in their crackdown on institutions collaborating with third-party agencies to help students from outside the city qualify for subsidised university programmes.
fullContent: Hong Kong education authorities have suspended a second private school in their crackdown on institutions collaborating with third-party agencies to help students from outside the city qualify for subsidised university programmes. The Education Bureau said on Monday that it was “very seriously” looking into institutions that were allegedly collaborating with placement or tutoring agencies to operate “shell schools”, which helped students gain local status. title: Drone Strike Halts Rosneft Oil Refinery Operations
summary: A Sunday drone attack on the Saratov refinery, owned by Russia’s oil giant Rosneft, prompted the facility to halt the intake of crude oil, a source with knowledge of the matter told Bloomberg on Monday.
fullContent: A Sunday drone attack on the Saratov refinery, owned by Russia’s oil giant Rosneft, prompted the facility to halt the intake of crude oil, a source with knowledge of the matter told Bloomberg on Monday. The Saratov Refinery in the Volga region has the capacity to process 140,000 barrels per day (bpd) of crude, but it has now been forced offline due to Ukrainian drone strikes. The Saratov refinery, which has been part of Rosneft since 2013, typically processes Russia’s flagship Urals crude oil and Saratovskoye…

title: Pritika Engineering Components Limited
summary: Dear Sir/ Madam, Subject: Intimation of Appointment of Company Secretary and Compliance Officer of the Company.Pursuant to Regulation 30 read with Part A of Schedule III of the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements)...
fullContent: Dear Sir/ Madam, Subject: Intimation of Appointment of Company Secretary and Compliance Officer of the Company.Pursuant to Regulation 30 read with Part A of Schedule III of the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015 ( SEBI Listing Regulations ), we hereby inform that the Board of Directors of the Company in its meeting held on today, the 11th August, 2025 has appointed Mr. Karan Malhotra (Membership No. ACS 62063) a qualified Company Secretary as Company Secretary & Compliance Officer designated as Key Managerial Personnel of the Company w.e.f. 11/8/2025.Details with respect to Change in Key Managerial Personnel (Appointment of Company Secretary and Compliance Officer) as required under Regulation 30 read with Part A of Schedule III of the SEBI Listing Regulations and SEBI Circular SEBI/HO/CFD/ PoD2/ CIR/P/0155 dated 11th November 2024, as amended is provided in Annexure to this letter.Kindly take the above information on record. |SUBJECT: Change in Company Secretary/Compliance Officer

summary: Subject: Intimation of Resignation of Company Secretary and Compliance Officer of the Company.Pursuant to Regulation 30 read with Part A of Schedule III of the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015, we hereby...
fullContent: Subject: Intimation of Resignation of Company Secretary and Compliance Officer of the Company.Pursuant to Regulation 30 read with Part A of Schedule III of the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015, we hereby inform you that Mr. Chander Bhan Gupta (Mem No. F2232) has resigned from the position of Company Secretary and Compliance Officer of the Company w.e.f. 11th August, 2025. Copy of resignation is attached.Details with respect to Change in Key Managerial Personnel (Resignation of Company Secretary and Compliance Officer) as required under Regulation 30 read with Part A of Schedule III of the SEBI Listing Regulations and SEBI Circular SEBI/HO/CFD/ PoD2/ CIR/P/0155 dated 11th November 2024, as amended is provided in Annexure to this letter.Kindly take the above information on record. |SUBJECT: Change in Company Secretary/Compliance Officer

title: Sluggish consumption momentum drags Bata’s Q1 net profit down 71% at ₹51.99 crore
summary: Shah said the company’s initiatives on inventory, merchandising and decluttering continued to work well. It added 20 franchise stores in the quarter, driven by a franchise model focused on town expansion and semi-urban markets.
fullContent: Shah said the company’s initiatives on inventory, merchandising and decluttering continued to work well. It added 20 franchise stores in the quarter, driven by a franchise model focused on town expansion and semi-urban markets.
